Name: Cuban Bishop
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
Instructions: POUR ingredients into heated blazer mug. Ignite mixture and lower garnish through flame into mixture. STIR. Remover garnish with tongs and place in serving vessel. POUR the hot drink into serving vessel over garnish. Special ingredient #1 : Ginger flavoured brown sugar
Review: “The inspiration comes from a classic cocktail called ‘Bishop’, which involved heating port wine and sugar with a clove-studded orange. There were many variations on this cocktail, so I decided to experiment with ways to adapt the recipe using BACARDÍ rum to create something completely new.”
History: Hong Kong BACARDÍ Legacy 2014 winning cocktail created by Ryan Chan at Lobster Bar and Grill, Island Shangri-La Hotel, Hong Kong.
Garnish: Long piece of orange peel studded with cloves
